JOINT SUB REGISTRAR
Scanned with OKEN Scanner :: 2 ::
You are my wife. Out of my affection and love for you, and in return for my love, I intend to transfer to you some immovable property free of charge, the immovable property listed in the Schedule below, which is my ancestral property, registered in my name in the Panchayat accounts and which has been in my complete possession till today, along with all the rights I have, including water, treasury deposits, common water ways, common roads, easement rights, etc., I hereby write this settlement deed and transfer the said property free of charge to you today. Therefore, from now on, you shall be the full rightful owner and shall pay all taxes due to the Government and shall enjoy the property freely and freely as you wish, with full rights of gift and sale, for the benefit of your children and grandchildren.
In this regard, I, my heirs, and I, whatever may arise from any hindrances, encumbrances, or obstacles, I will resolve them all for you and your heirs at our own expense and implement the Scheduled Property in this manner without interruption.
This settlement deed is written in your name, making you believe and believe that this property is an undisputed and unalienable property to which no other person has previously made any mortgages, purchases, purchase agreements, leases, guarantees, etc. There are no other male or female heirs or beneficiaries of this property except me. This property has not been assigned under Government Act No. 9/77. Accordingly, the deeds are filed for the registration of this property in your name. Aaru Gollu Venkatarao Nini

Declaration-1:- The property as per schedule includes mango, coconut, sweet potato trees, betel leaves There are no gardens, granite mines, fish ponds, missionary etc. I am fully liable for the payment of depreciation tax if so proved.
Declaration-2:- I do hereby declare that the property as per the schedule mentioned in this deed belongs to me alone, that no other person has ever encroached upon the said property, and that I shall be liable to the punishment mentioned in section-82 of the Registration Act, 1908, if I am found to have violated the provisions of section-22B of the Registration Act, 1908.

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 1025 of 2026, dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by Arugollu Venkata Rao in favour of his Wife, Arugollu Jyothi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 71.11 Sq. Yds., dismantle house number 5-173, Assessment No. 737, comprised in survey number 106, situated in Talluru Village & Grama Panchayti, Gandepalle Mandal, within the District of Kakinada, registered at sub-registrar office Kakinada (R.O), is bounded as follows:

North by: 32 Fts – Site Of Arugollu Venkatesulu
South by: 32 Fts – House Of Srimanthula David Raj
East by: 20 Fts – Panchayathi Cement Road
West by: 20 Fts – House Of Kommukuri Chinna Venkan­na
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the scheduled property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
